text: Kashmiri (کٲشُر) is a language from the Dardic subgroup of the Indo-Aryan languages.George L. Campbell; Gareth King, Compendium of the World's Languages (Oxford; New York: Routledge, 2013), p. 492 It is spoken primarily in the Kashmir Valley, in Indian-administered Kashmir and Neelam and Leepa valleys in Azad Kashmir.One Thousand Languages: Living, Endangered, and Lost, ed. Peter Austin (Berkeley: University of California Press, 2008), p. 130 ==Related pages== *Languages of Pakistan == References == ==Other websites== *The word Koshur written on manuscript Category:Dardic languages Category:Languages of Azad Jammu and Kashmir Category:Languages of Jammu and Kashmir Category:Languages of India Category:Languages of Pakistan
title: Kashmiri language
